metadata.title: CVE-2023-2176 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in compare_netdev_and_ip indrivers/infiniband/core/cma.c in RDMA in the Linux Kernel. The impropercleanup results in out-of-boundary read, where a local user can utilizethis problem to crash the system or escalation of privilege.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2176` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-25-generic - 6.2.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-25-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-25-generic - 6.2.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-25-generic-64k - 6.2.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-kvm - 6.2.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1007-aws - 6.2.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1007-azure - 6.2.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-gcp - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-ibm - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1008.8
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1007-oracle - 6.2.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1008-raspi - 6.2.0-1008.10
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1003-allwinner - 5.19.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1003-starfive - 5.19.0-1003.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-25.25').
linux-kvm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.8').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1007.7').
linux-azure package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1007.7').
linux-gcp package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1009.9').
linux-ibm package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1005.5').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.8').
linux-oracle package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1007.7').
linux-raspi package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.10').
linux-allwinner package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1003.3').
linux-starfive package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1003.4').
